title.narrative: Regional Youth Cooperation Office (RYCO) - institutional support
Regional Youth Cooperation Office (RYCO) - institutional support

description.narrative:
Sida avser att ingå ett långsiktigt samarbete med Regional Youth Cooperation Office (RYCO) med syfte att stärka ungdomars aktörskap på västra Balkan. Sidas bedömning är dock att RYCOs kapacitet är svag och har därför genomfört en ISK som ligger till grund för innevarande stöd. I dialog med RYCO avser Sida att stödja RYCO initialt i syfte att stärka organisationens institutionella kapacitet för att därefter planera fortsatt verksamhet till gagn för västra Balkans unga.
För perioden 2020-2021 (14 månader) har RYCO ansökt om finansiering om 138 600 EURO (cirka 1,5 miljoner SEK) för institutionell kapacitetsuppbyggnad. Insatsen syftar till att förbättra RYCO: s institutionella kapacitet genom att bidra till effektivitet och hållbarhet i RYCO: s verksamhet. Detta väntas göras genom tre aktiviteter;
Aktivitet 1: Anställa fem (heltid) experter/tjänstemän, inom i) HR ii) juridik iii) upphandling iv) ekonomi , samt v) bokföring
Aktivitet 2: Anställa en internationell advokatbyrå/expert, helst med professionell bakgrund och erfarenhet av diplomati och / eller internationella relationer som kan ge råd och assistera RYCO: s personal i att slutföra den officiella registreringen av RYCO: s lokala kontor i respektive land samt granskning av de juridiska och avtalsmässiga utmaningar som finns relaterade till anställnings- och serviceavtal inom RYCO.
Aktivitet 3: Inköp av kontorsmaterial

Sida intends to enter into long-term cooperation with the Regional Youth Cooperation Office (RYCO) with the aim of strengthening youth participation in the Western Balkans. However, Sida's assessment is that RYCO's capacity is weak and has therefore conducted an ISK that is the basis for the current support. In dialogue with RYCO, Sida intends to initially support RYCO with the aim of strengthening the organisation's institutional capacity and subsequently planning further activities for the benefit of the Western Balkan youth.
RYCO has applied for funding of EUR 138 600 (approximately SEK 1.5 million) for institutional capacity building, during the period 2020-2021 (14 months). The intervention aims at enhancing RYCOs institutional capacities by contributing to the efficiency and sustainability of RYCO Operations. This will be done through three activities;
Activity 1: Hire five (full time) experts/officers to enable efficiency in RYCO Operations; i) Senior Human Resources Officer ii) Senior Legal Officer iii) Senior Procurement Officer iv) Financial Assistant v) Accounting Firm
Activity 2: Hire an international law firm/ law expert, preferably with a professional background and experience in diplomacy and/or international relations that could advice, assist, and in cooperation with RYCO’s staff, to finalize the official registration of the Local Branches of RYCO in the respective Contracting parties and Review of legal and contractual challenges related to employment and service contracts within RYCO.
Activity 3: Purchase Office Supplies
The specific objective of this contribution is to enhance RYCO institutional capacities by contributing to the efficiency and sustainability of RYCO Operations.

title.narrative: Beslut om insats, Regional Youth Cooperation Office (RYCO) - Institutional support

description.narrative:
The planned activities in the program were as follows:
Activity 1: Hiring five (full-time) experts / officials, within i) HR ii) law iii) procurement iv) finance, and v) accounting
Activity 2: Hire an international law firm / expert, preferably with a professional background and experience in diplomacy and / or international relations who can advise and assist RYCO's staff in completing the official registration of RYCO's local offices in each country and review. of the legal and contractual challenges that are related to employment and service agreements within RYCO.
Activity 3: Purchase of office supplies
In regard to the first activity the report shows that Ryco has hired four experts within HR, law, procurement and finance. It has not hired an expert on accounting but instead purchased an accounting firm. No explanation is given to this decision in the report and Sida has asked for a clarification. Since January 2022, all other four positions are accommodated under RYCOs core budget or through different other project budgets, recognizing the necessity of those roles for the organizations functionality. However, the future status of this positions in the organizational chart will be reviewed through a functional analysis process that is conducted by Deloitte during the spring and funded by GIZ.
In regard to the second activity the report says that Ryco has hired an international law firm and that the process in order to obtain legal status for registration for local offices probably will be finalised in June 2022.
In regard to the third activity Ryco has purchased five computers and four printers.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
